pr_title: Extend InvalidTagsCheck with regex filtering for illegal sources

timeline.message:
Raw implementation of BadValueTagCheck

- added check structure and config files
- added rudimentary tests
- code not in final shape

Merge pull request #1 from osmlab/dev

Merge upstream

Merge pull request #2 from mm-ciub/dev

Merge upstream

Minor style fixes

- code cleanup to pass build
- improved test data

Documentation and minor fixes

- added check readme and documentation
- changed regex string for here maps to check for maps
or url to avoid false cases of the word here

Extended InvalidTagsCheck with regex filters

- the InvalidTagsCheck also accepts RegexTaggableFilter
that can be configured from resource or inline configuration

Final touches on InvalidTagsCheck extension

- code improvements - reduced duplicate code
- documentation updated
- configured InvalidTagsCheck to look for illegal sources

Added missing test

- added a missing test for illegal source on edge

Merge pull request #3 from osmlab/dev

Update fork

Checkstyle fixes

- added missing 'this.' before local method reference

Code smell fixes

- used constant for common String 'regex'
- used format specifier

timeline.bodyText: Looks like the java docs were not updated when these params were modified in a previous PR. The current config just has "filters.resource.override". Since this check is going to be updated for #377, we can update these in the upcoming PR. @mm-ciub
timeline.author: sayas01
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -34,50 +39,57 @@
 
 /**
  * This flags features based on configurable filters. Each filter passed contains the
- * {@link AtlasEntity} classes to check and a {@link TaggableFilter} to test objects against. If a
- * feature is of one of the given classes and passes the associated {@link TaggableFilter} then it
- * is flagged. In addition to the taggable filters, there are two configurable boolean values,
- * "filters.resource.append.override" and "filters.resource.append". If the
- * "filters.resource.append.override" key is set to true, only the filters passed through config are
- * used to flag the atlas features. If the "filters.resource.append" is set to true, the filters
- * passed through the config are appended to the default filters that are in the "invalidTags.txt"
- * resource file.
+ * {@link AtlasEntity} classes to check and a {@link TaggableFilter} or a
+ * {@link RegexTaggableFilter} to test objects against. If a feature is of one of the given classes
+ * and passes the associated filter then it is flagged. In addition to the taggable filters, there
+ * are two configurable boolean values, "filters.resource.append.override" and
+ * "filters.resource.append". If the "filters.resource.append.override" key is set to true, only the
